Ask HN: For those using Stable Diffusion locally, how do you filter fishy repos?
text:
I have been using the official release so far, and I see many new tools popping up every day, mostly GUIs. A substantial portion of them are closed-source, sometimes even simply offering an executable that you are supposed to blindly trust.

Not to go full Richard Stallman here, but is anybody else bothered by that? How do you deal with this situation, do you use a virtual machine, or is there any other ideas I am missing here?

title: Ask HN: What company has the best learning culture and why?
text:

Show HN: Chrome extension that extracts HTML+CSS from an element to inline style
text: Hi there. I spent the last couple months building this chrome extension to scratch my own itch. It allows you to extract a snippet of HTML along with its styles and export to inline styles or JSX. It’s not perfect and doesn’t work on every site. There is class support but I am still working on it along with some other cool features. Feedback is appreciated.

title: Are We Ready for the Next Volcano?
Ask HN: Are you a designer learning coding?
text:
Are you a visual designer or UX designer learning coding? Interested to hear your reasons for learning programming.

Is it one of the following reasons (or a combination)?

- Build your own product (i.e. learn programming so you won't have to rely on other delevlopers).

- Learn coding to add another skill to your toolbox, but not looking to becoming a full-time developer.

- Learning to understand the techology or the language of developers, but not looking to change your design role.

- Learning programming to become a full-time developer (change career).

Note: This question isn't related to current discussions about AI-generated images, but feel free to add any thoughts on the impact of AI on design.
